'''''Bummsdrápa''''' is an unpublished three paged satirical poem "in pen and ink"<ref name="poem">{{webcite|author=|articleurl=https://explore.library.leeds.ac.uk/special-collections-explore/378420/bummsdrpa|articlename=Bummsdrápa|dated=6 February, 1952|website=[https://library.leeds.ac.uk/ University of Leeds library]|accessed=21 December, 2025}}</ref> that was written by [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] in the [[1920]]s or the early [[1930]]s<ref>{{webcite|author=[https://oxonmoot25.sched.com/ Oxonmoot 2025]|articleurl=https://oxonmoot25.sched.com/event/26ykj/tolkien-the-caveman-poetry-as-a-cudgel|articlename=Tolkien the Caveman: Poetry as a Cudgel|dated=5 September 2025|website=[https://sched.com/?utm_campaign=web&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=header&utm_source=oxonmoot25 Sched - The Best Event Management Software]|accessed=24 October 2025}}</ref>. The [[University of Leeds]] library obtained the manuscripts of ''Bummsdrápa'' on [[6 February]], [[1952]].<ref name="poem"/> The poem refers to the Kolbítar, a group founded by Tolkien to talk about Icelandic mythology. [[C.S. Lewis]], [[Richard Wagner]], and [[Wikipedia:Charles Talbut Onions|C.T. Onions]] were members of this group. The group preceded the creation of the [[Inklings]].<ref name="guide">{{CG|2RGI}}, Libraries and archives, Other Libraries and Archives: University of Leeds, pp. 515-7</ref>
